entry.title: Site redesign coming soon
entry.summary: Two-thirty a.m. is a pretty lonely hour, one that I don't see on the clock often, especially when I must wake up three-and-a-half hours later. entry.title: Lessons of a healer
entry.summary: I learned some good lessons yesterday, as well. Sharon and Dr. Rugg share an office space with a group of physical therapists called Midwest Physical Therapy. entry.title: Recipe for body maintenance
entry.summary: Yesterday I saw Dr. Rugg and Sharon again for the now monthly check-ups. It's amazing to realize that it took eleven months to diminish my need for adjustments from twice a week to once a month. As Dr. Rugg said, there worse things to be resigned to than a life of exercise. For the month of February

entry.title: I need magnesium
entry.summary:
Eesh. Everything feels like it's going too slow. I feel like my brain is going too fast!
I jogged and/or ran to the gym, lifted weights, and walked and/or lunged back. The weather is kissably sweet. I want to be outside forever and more.

entry.title: Performance
entry.summary: i had my first performance review today, and apparently i'm off to great start in my career. i expect no less from myself. even if it's something i don't like, if it's something i have decided to do anyway, i must excel. yeah i wonder why it took me this long to verbalize it, but it feels natural to

entry.title: Another Quick Note
entry.summary: Yesterday morning I jogged to the gym and lifted weights. I could bench press more than usual, even though I hadn't pumped iron in a week. entry.title: A Quick Note
entry.summary: Weeks ago, when I did the static wall splits, I couldn't hold it for more than 15 or 20 seconds. Some time later, I tried it again but more intensely.
